qas.question: What is the largest religion in St. John's?
What has declined in the recent years on St. John's?
What two religions divide the city?
In what year did Christian sects increase?

context: Predominantly <a0_0>Christian<a0_0/>, the population of St. John's was once divided along sectarian (<b3_0>Catholic/Protestant<b3_0/>) lines. In recent years, this <a1_0>sectarianism<a1_0/> has declined significantly, and is no longer a commonly acknowledged facet of life in St. John's. St. John's is the seat of the Roman Catholic Archbishop of St. John's, and the Anglican Bishop of Eastern Newfoundland and Labrador. All major <a2_0>Christian<a2_0/> sects showed a decline from <b4_0>2001–2011<b4_0/> with a large increase in those with no religion from 3.9% to 11.1%.
